qas.question: What year were most military occupations opened to women?
What military occupation wasn't opened to women until the 2000s?
By how much did opening these jobs to women increase the recruiting pool by?
Which government was responsible in Canadian history for this fact?
What year were most military occupations opened to men?
hat military occupation wasn't opened to men until the 2000s?
By how much did opening these jobs to men increase the recruiting pool by?
Which government was responsible in French history for this fact?

context: All military occupations were open to women in <a0_0><b4_0>1989<b4_0/><a0_0/>, with the exception of <a1_0><b5_0>submarine service<b5_0/><a1_0/>, which opened in 2000. Throughout the 1990s, the introduction of women into the combat arms increased the potential recruiting pool by about <a2_0><b6_0>100 percent<b6_0/><a2_0/>. It also provided opportunities for all persons to serve their country to the best of their abilities. Women were fully integrated in all occupations and roles by <a3_0>the <b7_0>government of Jean Chretien<b7_0/><a3_0/>, and by 8 March 2000, even allowed to serve on submarines.
